Comment: The master sticks to standard lines.
The usual move nowadays. 2 B-B4 was standard until the middle of the 19th century.
What the...? That's why he's an amateur. This is the worst possible way to defend the pawn. I'd play 2... P-KB3 before resorting to this.
If Black had played any other 2nd move, he could now follow up with 4... N-KB3 and prepare to castle into safety.
Why wasn't this played on move 2?
Opening a line for the QB to now come out.
Unnatural, but because of the second move there is no good square.
...with disastrous results. The Queen is trapped and Black resigns immediately.
